Job Title: Construction Manager

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

Industrial Construction - Traveling - Leading EPCM - Large Ground Up Projects

This Jobot Job is hosted by Alex Moore

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $120,000 - $170,000 per year

A Bit About Us

We are a global engineering, construction, and architecture company providing our clients a wide range of services. Our team of experts leads our clients through complex projects in a wide range of industries, from EPC Construction projects, Energy, Water and environmental, and Building Architecture and Design.

We are currently looking for individuals with large project experience in the construction of manufacturing facilities.



Why join us?


Compensation range from $110k - $170k (Bonuses/per diem/car allowance/overtime)

This is a traveling role - some projects are 6 months, and others are 3 years. We typically send the team home every two weeks for a 3 day weekend.

 Exceptional Benefits Package Company-paid life, short-term, and long-term disability insurance! 401k with match Dental Insurance Vision insurance Health insurance Paid time off

Investment in Your Development We prioritize your personal and professional growth from the moment you join us.

Guidance from Trusted Leaders Benefit from leaders who embody our Leadership Principles, providing support and mentorship.

Recognition for Your Uniqueness Be valued for the individual you are, bringing diverse perspectives to our collaborative projects.

Inspiration at Every Turn Find inspiration from a dynamic mix of colleagues, clients, and projects that challenge and invigorate you.

Long-Term Impact Join a foundation-owned company focused on the enduring impact of sustainable change, working at the heart of transformative initiatives.

Job Details

Job Details

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Construction Manager to join our growing team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the planning and execution of various construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about construction, enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, and has a keen eye for detail. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in EPC, Procurement, Industrial Construction and equipment installation experience.

Responsibilities

 Oversee all aspects of construction project from planning to implementation. Allocate resources for assigned projects. Implement the scope of work for construction and commissioning of equipment  Work with design and engineering team on layout and process for site Ensure that all changes to work scope and specifications are well documented before implementing  Supervise onsite personnel and subcontractors. Interface with project inspectors, contractors, architects, engineers, city and county officials, and clients. Negotiate with contractors to receive reasonable order costs. Maintain high standards of workmanship that adhere to original plans and specifications. Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status. Plan ahead to prevent problems and resolve any emerging ones. Analyze, manage and mitigate risks. Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques.

Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in construction management, architecture, engineering or related field. Experience managing budgets from $50M - $150M Past experience organizing the mechanical construction of project (MEP scope) as well as equipment installation (machines/equipment for facilities production) Minimum of 7 years of experience in construction management or related field Proficient in EPC, Procurement, Industrial, Manufacturing, Construction, EPCM, Scheduling and Primavera. Understanding of all facets of the construction process. Familiarity with construction management software packages. Ability to plan and see the “big picture”. Competent in conflict and crisis management. Excellent time and project management skills. Outstanding communication and negotiation skills. Excellent organizational and leadership skills. 

Join our team and take the next step in your career with a company that values talent, innovation, and dedication. We look forward to hearing from you!

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
